content.rendered:
Gangotri Yatra

Location: Uttarakhand, India
District: Uttarkashi
Population: 606
Religion: Hinduism 100 %
Elevation: 3,415 m (11,204 ft)
Language: Hindi, Garhwali

Weather: 22° C - 5° C

Ideal Duration: 2-3 Days

Best Time: Apr-Jun

Nearest Airport: Dehradun

Lush valleys of tall green trees, narrow winding paths overlooked by the snowbound Himalayan peaks, clear blue skies and an omnipresent vibe of deep spirituality is what the holy pilgrimage town of Gangotri is all about. Gangotri tourism is primarily centered around the visit to the holy temple of Gangotri Dham which forms a major part of the holy Chhota Char Dham Yatra of Uttarakhand. The temple of Gangotri is placed on the bank of the holy Bhagirathi River which according to legend is the original place of birth of Ganga River.

Being a part of the greater Himalayan ranges the scenic beauty here is unparalleled and unlike anywhere else in India. Located within the holy district of Uttarkashi, as the name suggests this temple is dedicated to goddess Ganga and stands out as a stark contrast to the shades of green that surrounds this place. The temple is built entirely in glistening white marble and behind it is also the holy place where king Bhagirath is believed to have performed meditation to goddess Ganga to descend from heaven to the earthly realm. All these facts clubbed together makes this place immensely important for devotees and pilgrims from all over the world.

Gangotri travel guide nowadays include activities that interest adventure lovers and thrill-seekers. The Gaumukh Trek which goes beyond Gangotri Temple is among one of the most highly availed adventure activities that anyone can make. This will take you to the Gangotri Glacier after covering a trekking journey of 19 kms which is scientifically the original place of birth of Ganga River.

On the other hand, the Gangotri National Park gives the visitors a look inside the thriving ecosystem of the Himalayan ranges where plants, trees, animals, birds, and insects co-exist in an ultimate sense of peace.

Some other significant places of exploration in Gangotri include places like the famous Bhagirathi Shila and the Pandava Gufa. The Bhagirathi Shila is especially a significant part of our rich historical past since it is at this very rock that King Bhagirath had worshipped to goddess Ganga and asked her to come to the earthly realm and wash away the sins of not only his ancestors but for the rest of humanity from there on. Pandava Gufa, on the other hand, is a cave where the Pandava brothers are believed to have rested for some time before heading on to their journey to heaven.

In short, Gangotri is a one of a kind destination offering the best of everything from spirituality to views and adventure activities. It would be the perfect way of spending your holidays and vacation time with your family and loved ones. From nature lovers and peace seekers everyone can find their inner peace of mind by visiting Gangotri at least once in a lifetime. Visit the temple, spend time by the gushing river, explore the scenic surroundings and take away with you a lifetime’s worth of memories that you will cherish forever and maybe even feel compelled to come back for more.

About Gangotri

The graceful, elegant and humble temple of Gangotri is a crucial part of the holy Chhota Chardham Yatra that takes place annually on the Garhwal hills of Devbhumi Uttarakhand. Placed on an elevation of around 3,100 Metres above sea level this prominent Hindu pilgrim town is surrounded by immense and unmatched natural beauty. Apart from the obvious natural beauty, the overwhelming sense of spirituality and peace makes visiting this pious shrine totally worth it. As the name suggests the presiding deity inside the temple is that of goddess Ganga and is visited by devotees and pilgrims from all over the world.

Located within the scenic district of Uttarkashi, the temple marks the place where goddess Ganga had made her way from the heaven to the earthly realm. To achieve this king Bhagirath had to meditate for long hours and please Lord Shiva to let a stream of Ganga from his matted locks. Hence, River Ganga that flows here is known as Bhagirathi and later on, it goes on to meet Alaknanda River at Devprayag forming the holy River Ganga that goes on to purify the departed souls. Ever since this holy river had made her presence on earth, the people have been offering prayer, and submerging the mortal remains of the departed souls to grant them Moksha or salvation making it one of the Holiest River in India.

Initially the temple building was not made so Amar Singh Thapa decided to preserve this place by creating a temple at this sacred spot.

Later on, after the devastating earthquake during the 18th century, the temple structure was rebuilt by the maharani of Jaipur which now stands tall and graceful. Just like the other temples of Chhota Char Dham Yatra of Uttarakhand including Kedarnath, Badrinath, and Yamunotri, this temple remains open for a limited duration of 6 months. Apart from the spiritual aspect the temple also marks as the starting point for the thrilling and adventure-filled trek and camping expedition to the source of Ganga River which is located 19 kms away from the temple, known as Gaumukh Glacier.

The entire pilgrim village is dotted all over with interesting places to explore which hold not only spiritual value but is also the perfect way of feeling closer to nature and finding some time in peace. Some other interesting things one could do (apart from temple Darshan) include visiting the famous Bhagirathi Shila - the rock where king Bhagirath had performed serious meditation and Pandava Gufa - the holy cave where the Pandava brothers had taken a brief halt while on their way to heaven. The greenery, lush valleys, expansive meadows, and unpolluted air everything works in perfect sync to create on the most awe-inspiring and beautiful places to visit. Did you know that after the closing of Gangotri Dham Temple, one can still offer their prayer to the goddess at her winter home in Mukhba Village? Gangotri Dham is easily reachable by road and makes for the perfect getaway with family, friends and loved ones.

Holiday Packages

Holiday packages for Gangotri are available at the best rates and designed in a way that will suit your needs and requirement. The holiday packages will include fun filled experiences ranging from offering Darshan at the temple, going on adventure treks and checking out the nearby sightseeing locations that are also major spiritual centres. Book the right package for Gangotri Dham visit with your family, loved ones and friends and create memories that will last you a lifetime. Available now at the most exclusive rates travelling on the hills never seemed better. Book the right package for you now!

Things to Do

People visit Gangotri Temple to offer their Darshan at the holy temple of goddess Ganga and spend some time in peace at the Bhagirathi Shila. Apart from various spiritual activities, one can even go on adventure thrilling activities like trekking and camping until the source of Ganga River up to the Glacier of Gaumukh. The scenic beauty here is unmatched and each day will seem to unveil a new activity or an adventure. Taking a walk in this Himalayan beauty village and letting your hair down here is something everyone should do.
